page.title: 09Transport 1. (A66)
page.content: The old A66 has been existance since 1700. It was the main road to Keswick, and before that was a pack horse route for iron ore and wool into Cockermouth. It was a country road from Castlegate to Keswick. Like the A595 to Carlisle it would have been used initially by the mail coach, farmers and private carriages.During the early 1900's it was also used by motor vehicles; increasingly after 1958 when Derwent school and the housing estate were finished. The use of the 'old' A66 decreased dramatically in 1973 after the completion of the 'new' A66 by-pass which provides a faster route to Keswick and the M6 in the east and Workington in the west.
